description: The woman sentenced to life in prison for killing Tejano music icon Selena in 1995 has been denied parole, the Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles said Thursday, Yolanda Saldívar was convicted of fatally shooting Selena, the Mexican-American singer known as the “Queen of Tejano” music whose full name was Selena Quintanilla Pérez, at a Days Inn motel in Corpus Christi on March 31, 1995.
title: Yolanda Saldívar, the woman convicted of killing Selena, is denied parole

description: The Department of Education is investigating a California law that bars public schools from disclosing to parents the sexual orientation of their children.
title: Education Dept. opens investigation into California schools' gender identity law

description: President Donald Trump expressed frustration with national security adviser Michael Waltz Thursday in his conversations with people about his decision to withdraw Rep.
title: Trump privately vents his frustration about Michael Waltz

description: Megan Fox is a mom again.
title: Megan Fox welcomes baby with Machine Gun Kelly

description: In today’s newsletter, we bring you the findings from our new focus group of Black men who voted for Donald Trump in 2024.
title: How a slice of Trump's coalition is viewing his presidency: From the Politics Desk

description: A computer science student at Columbia University said he has been kicked out by the school after he built an artificial intelligence tool to cheat in tech job interviews and documented the fallout online.
title: Kicked out of Columbia, this student doesn’t plan to stop trolling big tech with AI

description: Since Kylie Kelce‘s fourth daughter could make an appearance any day now, birth plans have been top of mind for the podcasting mom.
title: Kylie Kelce shuts down people who judge C-section births

description: School officials in Maine said they will not comply with a Trump administration agreement that would bar trans athletes from participating in girls’ sports.
title: Maine officials won’t comply with the Trump administration's trans athlete ban

description: Transgender people in Montana can no longer use bathrooms in public buildings that do not align with their sex assigned at birth.
title: Transgender bathroom restrictions take effect as Montana governor signs law

description: Senators at a hearing on campus antisemitism said the Trump administration will be hamstrung by recent firings in its efforts to fight discrimination.
title: At a hearing on campus antisemitism, Democrats question gutting of civil rights staff

description: Senators are expecting to receive a consequential decision that will shape whether Republicans can make President Donald Trump’s expiring tax cuts permanent.
title: Senate braces for high-stakes ruling that will decide the fate of Trump's tax cuts

description: A 21-year-old man faces charges in a $1.2 million Corvette heist after law enforcement recovered eight luxury vehicles stolen from a Kentucky plant.
title: Michigan man charged with stealing 8 Corvettes worth $1.2M in Kentucky heist

description: A DHS worker was punished after mistakenly sharing a sensitive email with a journalist, raising questions about unequal treatment for inadvertent leakers.
title: A DHS staffer faces serious punishment for accidentally adding a reporter to a group email

description: New conversations with Black men who voted for Donald Trump in swing states in November showed that nearly all of them remain staunchly with him, but his administration’s Department of Government Efficiency and his tariffs are potential pain points for the president among his supporters.
title: Focus group: Black men who backed Trump approve of his presidency — but raise some concerns about DOGE

description: Days after an Atlanta man died in a scuba diving accident in Hawaii, authorities said they found the skeletal remains of his of his son who had gone missing four years prior in a tree house in his backyard.
title: Skeletal remains of missing son found in backyard tree house days after father dies in scuba accident

description: Gen Z is spotting warnings of an economic slowdown in everything from "The White Lotus" to brown clothes: "The vibes are off."
title: #RecessionIndicator: Young Americans are losing confidence in the economy — and it shows online

description: The Buffalo Bills’ quest for a Super Bowl title will take a slight detour this coming season.
title: Hallmark reveals which NFL team will be the new focus of ‘Countdown to Christmas’ movie

description: A powerful moment between two “Survivor” contestants on rival tribes brought Jeff Probst to tears, which he said has “never happened” in his 25 years of hosting the show.
title: 'Survivor' host Jeff Probst cries after contestant opens up about her autism diagnosis

description: Just months after raging wildfires destroyed thousands of homes in the Los Angeles area, California-based KB Home is unveiling what it calls its first “wildfire-resilient” community.
title: KB Home unveils its first 'fire-resilient' community in Southern California

description: Police arrested a 36-year -old Las Vegas cinematographer and accused of him throwing Molotov cocktails and opening fire on Teslas earlier this month, officials said Thursday.

description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James and ESPN commentator Stephen A. Smith escalated their war of words that began earlier this month when James confronted Smith during a Lakers game over Smith’s coverage of his son.

description: When Jon Paul Pérez graduated college, he assumed he would go to work for his father.

description: Ferrari said Thursday it will raise prices by 10% on certain models after April 1 in response to new U.S. auto tariffs, adding up to $50,000 to the price of a typical Ferrari.
title: Ferrari says it will raise prices by 10% on some models to offset auto tariffs

description: The Sundance Film Festival will be making a move to Boulder, Colorado, in 2027 after more than 40 years in Park City, Utah, organizers announced Thursday.
title: Sundance Film Festival moves to Boulder, Colorado, after over 40 years in Park City, Utah

description: The Trump administration is still grappling with the revelation from Monday that several senior officials discussed plans to strike Houthi rebels in Yemen in a Signal chat that inadvertently included The Atlantic magazine's editor-in-chief, Jeffrey Goldberg.
title: Timeline: The Trump administration's shifting stance on the Signal chat debacle

description: The U.S. Department of Education announced it is re-opening the online applications for income-driven repayment plans, the programs used by millions of federal student loan borrowers to repay their debt.
title: Trump administration re-opens student loan repayment plan applications

description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said Thursday he was pulling the nomination of Rep.
title: Trump pulls Rep. Elise Stefanik's nomination to be U.N. ambassador

description: The chance to draw Betty White for a U.S. postage stamp was an easy “yes” for Boston-based illustrator Dale Stephanos.

description: Buyer difficulty is easing. However, prices remain high, and experts say progress could ride on policy decisions — tariffs and trade wars chief among them.
title: The housing search is easing, but a prolonged trade war could derail progress

description: In a scene straight from a horror movie, a babysitter in Kansas was checking for "monsters" to reassure a scared child — and found a man hiding under the bed.
title: Kansas child said 'monster' was under their bed; babysitter finds man hiding there

description: The Department of Health and Human Services plans to cut 10,000 jobs across several agencies as part of the Trump administration's efforts to restructure the federal government.
title: HHS plans to cut 10,000 employees across the department

description: Utah Republican Gov. Spencer Cox signed a bill into law Wednesday that will phase out the state's universal vote-by-mail system.
title: Utah governor signs bill to phase out state's universal mail ballot system

description: The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will retest about 4,000 DNA samples after discovering some exam kits used last year and in early 2025 might be prone to "intermittently poor performance," authorities said Wednesday.
title: Los Angeles sheriff retesting 4,000 DNA samples due to possible error

description: Duke University slams HBO's 'The White Lotus' for using its apparel during suicide attempt scene
title: Duke slams HBO's 'The White Lotus' for using its apparel in suicide attempt scene

description: Democratic senators sent a letter demanding an investigation into the Trump administration’s "disastrous" efforts to dismantle the Education Department.
title: Democratic senators want an investigation into Trump's Education Department cuts

description: A group of  young Mexican Americans created their own avenues for art to fight exclusion; the documentary "ASCO: Without Permission," executive produced by Gael García Bernal and Diego Luna, charts their rise to fame.
title: How a 1970s Chicano art group defied the mainstream and made history

description: General Motors shares fell more than 7% Thursday as investors weighed the auto giant’s outsize vulnerability to the tariffs President Donald Trump announced Wednesday.
title: GM shares tank as U.S. auto industry digests new Trump tariffs

description: Faced with the Trump administration’s crackdown and Columbia University's concessions, students say protesting simply isn’t worth the risk.
title: At Columbia, Trump's crackdown chills a fervent campus

description: The biological mother of a Connecticut man allegedly held captive for decades by his stepmother has revealed new details about why she gave up custody — and vowed to be there for him now.
title: Biological mom of man allegedly held captive thought giving up custody would give him 'a better chance'

description: Oil executives are warning that President Donald Trump’s tariffs and his “drill, baby, drill” message have created uncertainty in energy markets that is already affecting investment.
title: Oil executives bluntly criticize Trump tariffs and 'drill, baby, drill' in anonymous survey

description: Another day of fire danger is forecast throughout the Carolinas as wildfires continue to rage due to wind, low humidity, and a tinderbox of dry, downed timber left in the wake of Hurricane Helene.
title: Wildfires continue to rage in the Carolinas as hundreds are evacuated from homes

description: A doctor accused of trying to push his wife off a hiking trail and hitting her with a rock this week has been charged with second-degree attempted murder, Honolulu police said on Wednesday.
title: Maui doctor charged with attempted murder of his wife

description: The Department of Health and Human Services said Thursday it plans to cut 10,000 full-time jobs across several agencies, as part of a broader effort by the Trump administration to restructure many parts of the federal government.
title: HHS plans to shutter or downsize several health agencies, including at CDC

description: Just days after placing fourth at the U.S.
title: Figure skater whose parents died in D.C. plane crash says they changed their flight

description: World War II veteran-turned-internet star known as Papa Jake attended a spring training game between the Giants and Tigers — and he got to throw out the first pitch three months after celebrating his 102nd birthday! TODAY’s Jenna Bush Hager shares this Morning Boost.
title: 102-year-old WWII veteran throws 1st pitch at spring training game

description: Play ball! Excitement is building among fans and players as the 2025 Major League Baseball season kicks off with the Opening Day game. Reporting for TODAY, NBC’s Sam Brock shares a look at the players and teams to look out for this season.
title: MLB Opening Day is here! Here are the star players to look out for

description: Mario René López is being held at an ICE facility in Virginia, though he says he obtained citizenship as a minor from his mom, who naturalized in 1998.
title: 'A nightmare': Man detained by ICE for more than 2 years claims he's a U.S. citizen

description: A doctoral student at the University of Alabama has been arrested and detained by immigration authorities, as the Trump administration continues to target non-U.S.
title: University of Alabama doctoral student detained by ICE as government's college crackdown continues

description: President Donald Trump issued an overnight threat to place "far larger" tariffs on the European Union and Canada than planned if they work together to retaliate in response to his tariffs.
title: Trump threatens 'far larger' tariffs on E.U. and Canada if they unite to do 'economic harm' to U.S.

description: Trump is expected to sign additional executive orders this afternoon in the Oval Office, according to the White House.
title: Trump to sign more executive orders today

description: The Atlantic editor-in-chief Jeffrey Goldberg, who was accidentally added to a group chat with Vice President JD Vance and nearly all of the Trump administration senior national security leaders where military plans were being discussed, released the entire text chain of messages. It comes as more Republicans are pressing for an investigation with the White House remaining defiant in the face of mounting backlash. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Democrats demand accountability as Atlantic releases full chain

description: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday that he is imposing a 25% tariff on all cars and car parts imported into the United States. Nearly half of all vehicles sold in the United States are imported and many companies, even if they have American factories, use foreign car parts. NBC’s Christine Romans reports for TODAY.
title: Trump announces 25% tariff on imported cars: What's the strategy?

description: While some people may decry the lack of upsets in the first two rounds of the men’s NCAA Tournament, the result is a Sweet 16 filled with the best teams in the country.
title: NCAA Tournament: Duke-Arizona highlights loaded Sweet 16 slate

description: Trump's foreign cars tariffs. April 2 “Liberation Day.” Michael Waltz blamed for chat leak. Fewer weather balloons mean less accurate forecast. F1 driver shakeup.
title: Trump's auto tariffs and Michael Waltz's role in Signal group chat: Morning Rundown

description: New Politics, a group focused on supporting candidates from service backgrounds, is launching a multimillion-dollar effort to recruit thousands of candidates over the next four years.
title: 'A crisis moment': New Politics launches $20 million push to recruit service-oriented candidates

description: The 2025 Major League Baseball season is here, kicking off a six-month regular season into the postseason. These are the stars to watch.
title: The big bats and live arms poised to dictate the 2025 MLB season

description: Former national security officials and Democrats rejected the Trump administration’s assertion that no secrets were disclosed when detailed U.S. air strike plans were inadvertently shared with a journalist on Signal.

description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump's immigration policies were deeply unpopular in his first term.

description: Measles vaccination rates for young children may be far lower than publicly reported. The U.S. could be closer than expected to losing its “elimination status.”

description: Next week’s Wisconsin Supreme Court race is emerging as the first big test of Democrats’ anti-Elon Musk strategy as the party searches for a winning message following its loss to President Donald Trump last November.
title: Wisconsin provides a critical test for Democrats' anti-Elon Musk playbook

description: Some weather balloon launches have been suspended because of the Trump administration’s cuts to the National Weather Service. That may hurt forecast accuracy.
title: With fewer weather balloons due to government staffing cuts, forecasts may be less accurate

description: In a major shake-up for the world of Formula 1, the Red Bull Racing team has decided to replace Liam Lawson after just two Grand Prix weekends in 2025 when he performed poorly
title: Major shake-up in F1: Red Bull replaces Liam Lawson with Yuki Tsunoda after just two races

description: Three Phoenix police officers will receive 24-hour, unpaid suspensions, and two of them must undergo more training, after the arrest of a deaf man who has cerebral palsy last year, the police chief said Wednesday.
title: Phoenix officers suspended for 24 hours after repeatedly punching deaf man with cerebral palsy during arrest

description: A Michigan resident who received a transplant in December died after getting infected with rabies from the new organ, the state's health department said.
title: Michigan patient dies after contracting rabies through a transplanted organ

description: A growing number of Donald Trump’s allies are calling on the president to fire his national security adviser, Michael Waltz.
title: 'Somebody has to go down': Trump allies take aim at Michael Waltz

description: A woman who won an $83.5 million lottery jackpot in Texas last month is still waiting for her payout as officials sort out whether the way she purchased the ticket will prevent her from collecting the winnings.
title: Winner of an $83.5 million Texas lottery jackpot last month still waiting for payout
